text: Aristippus of Larissa in Thessaly was one of the Aleuadae who received lessons from the philosopher Gorgias when he visited Thessaly. Aristippus obtained money and troops from Cyrus the Younger to resist a faction opposed to him, and placed his lover, the general Meno, in command over these forces.Xenophon, Anabasis 1.1.10, 2.6.28Plato, Meno ==References== Category:People from Larissa (regional unit) Category:5th-century BC Greek people
title: Aristippus of Larissa
